sentences: Lapsed käivad koolis aastas viie päeva nädalas.
context: The word 'aastas' is an Estonian adverb that means 'per year' or 'annually'. It indicates frequency or rate over the course of a full year. In Estonian grammar, it's formed from the root word 'aasta' (year) with the '-s' suffix which typically denotes per-unit time expressions, similar to English constructions like 'per day', 'per hour', etc.
